agents.rlboa

Class RLBOAagentBilateral

  • java.lang.Object
    • genius.core.AgentAdapter
      • genius.core.Agent
        • genius.core.boaframework.BOAagentBilateral
          • agents.rlboa.RLBOAagentBilateral
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RLBOA, Listener<NegotiationEvent>, NegotiationParty, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Qlearner

    public abstract class RLBOAagentBilateral
extends BOAagentBilateral
implements RLBOA
    This class orchestrates the learning process of any BOAAgentBilateral that implements reinforcement learning into one of its components. To implement such an agent one needs to extends this class and implement ones own versions of the methods defined in the RLBOA interface.
    See Also:

      • agentSetup

        public abstract void agentSetup()
        Description copied from class: BOAagentBilateral

        Specified by:

      • notifyChange

        public void notifyChange(NegotiationEvent data)
        Description copied from interface: Listener
        a notification call that occurs when something changed. Consult the parent object for details about this event.

        NOTICE 1

        notifications run in the thread of the caller. The caller will be blocked until this callback has been completed. It is therfore good practice to handle callbacks quickly.

        NOTICE 2

        Notifications often cross a thread sarety boundary. For example when in MVC a model (typically thread safe) calls back a panel (not thread safe). The called side (the panel) thus must handle the callback in a thread safe manner, e.g. using SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable). We recommend to avoid synchronize as this will can block indefinitely (see notice 1) which might lead to deadlocks.
        Specified by:
        notifyChange in interface Listener<NegotiationEvent>
        Parameters:
        data - additional data, typically the new value associated with the event
